semantic__clause.semantic__p: IEC/IEC JSEG 15/WS 1 was established in 2023 to provide standardized terminology for IEC/ISO TCs in referencing concepts, terms and definitions relating to the Metaverse.
IEC/IEC JSEG 15/WS 1 is tasked to develop the following deliverables:

semantic__li.semantic__p: Set of concepts, terms and definitions, and their relationships
Definition of the “Metaverse”
Final report of WS 1 to provide recommendations to IEC/ISO

semantic__clause.semantic__p: The definition of a “metaverse” has long been subject of controversy.
In order to define any concept, it is necessary to determine the essential characteristics of the concept, where additions or subtractions to these characteristics will no longer define the concept.
The word “metaverse” originated from the science fiction Snow Crash written by Neal Stephenson in 1992 .

In popular culture, the term “metaverse” is commonly used as a generalized entity beyond the Internet, as a massively multi-player virtual world experienced through immersive technologies with comprehensive sensory integration through human computer interfaces.
The group has considered a few popular definitions of the “metaverse”, including:

semantic__li.semantic__p: From : “universal, immersive virtual world that is facilitated by virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR)”
From : persistent and immersive simulated world that is experienced in the first person by large groups of simultaneous users who share a strong sense of mutual presence
From : an infinite and persistent set of computer-generated virtual worlds that may be accessed via some human computer interface

semantic__clause.semantic__p: WS 1 has considered various definitions, common perspectives and expectations on the term “metaverse” and has come to the following conclusions based on consensus.
Essential characteristics of the “metaverse” include:

semantic__li.semantic__p: virtual, as in the items in the experience is virtual
immersive where it is experienced through human computer interaction

semantic__clause.semantic__p: Common characteristics expected by popular culture include:

semantic__li.semantic__p: massively multi-user where there can be many simultaneous users
interconnection of virtual world systems
interoperability between users across virtual world systems
persistent where actions and events in the virtual world persists after a user leaves
real-time where user actions are performed in real-time

semantic__clause.semantic__p: The resulting consensus arrived at this definition for “metaverse”:

semantic__quote.semantic__p: metaverse: virtual world experienced through immersive technologies

semantic__clause.semantic__p: This deliverable aims to provide a concept system and a standard set of terminology related to the Metaverse, from basic concepts to those of the Metaverse ecosystem.
Questions to be addressed:

semantic__li.semantic__p: What is a Metaverse or is there only THE metaverse (like THE Internet)?
Does the Metaverse require human interaction?
Is there an agreed or proposed definition /definitions?
What shall it include? What does it not include?
Is a digital twin a “metaverse” if not why not? Or when is it not?
What is the minimum set to be classed as a metaverse?

semantic__clause.semantic__p: IEC/IEC JSEG 15/WS 1 used the following methodology in developing the vocabulary:

semantic__li.semantic__p: Survey existing terminology
Reference / import over new creation unless necessary
Decide on terms and domains to import
Fill out data: definition, designations, languages, examples, notes

semantic__clause.semantic__p: The sources that are investigated include:

semantic__li.semantic__p: Metaverse Standards Forum glossary ()
Open Metaverse Foundation glossary ()
IEEE P2874 Spatial Web
ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 24 “Metaverse Vocabulary”
IEC/ISO/JSEG 15/WS 2 “Market and applications report”

semantic__clause.semantic__p: The group has developed a set of terms and definitions for the Metaverse ecosystem. The terms are organized in the following categories:

semantic__li.semantic__p: Metaverse core concepts
Metaverse use cases
XR concepts
Extended metaverse concepts
Governance

semantic__clause.semantic__p: The terms and definitions are provided in a separate document.
The group recommends the following:

semantic__li.semantic__p: The definition of the “metaverse” should be adopted by IEC/ISO TCs and publications
The Metaverse terminology provided should be adopted by IEC/ISO TCs

clause.title: 4.1Background
clause.p: IEC/IEC JSEG 15/WS 1 was established in 2023 to provide standardized terminology for IEC/ISO TCs in referencing concepts, terms and definitions relating to the Metaverse.

clause.title: 4.2Deliverables
clause.p: IEC/IEC JSEG 15/WS 1 is tasked to develop the following deliverables:

li.p: Set of concepts, terms and definitions, and their relationships
Definition of the “Metaverse”
Final report of WS 1 to provide recommendations to IEC/ISO

clause.title: 5.1General
clause.p: The definition of a “metaverse” has long been subject of controversy.

clause.title: 5.2Approach
clause.p: In order to define any concept, it is necessary to determine the essential characteristics of the concept, where additions or subtractions to these characteristics will no longer define the concept.

clause.title: 5.3Background
clause.p: The word “metaverse” originated from the science fiction Snow Crash written by Neal Stephenson in 1992 [4].

In popular culture, the term “metaverse” is commonly used as a generalized entity beyond the Internet, as a massively multi-player virtual world experienced through immersive technologies with comprehensive sensory integration through human computer interfaces.
The group has considered a few popular definitions of the “metaverse”, including:

li.p: From [1]: “universal, immersive virtual world that is facilitated by virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR)”
From [2]: persistent and immersive simulated world that is experienced in the first person by large groups of simultaneous users who share a strong sense of mutual presence
From [3]: an infinite and persistent set of computer-generated virtual worlds that may be accessed via some human computer interface

clause.title: 5.4Considerations
clause.p: WS 1 has considered various definitions, common perspectives and expectations on the term “metaverse” and has come to the following conclusions based on consensus.
Essential characteristics of the “metaverse” include:

li.p: virtual, as in the items in the experience is virtual
immersive where it is experienced through human computer interaction

clause.p: Common characteristics expected by popular culture include:

li.p: massively multi-user where there can be many simultaneous users
interconnection of virtual world systems
interoperability between users across virtual world systems
persistent where actions and events in the virtual world persists after a user leaves
real-time where user actions are performed in real-time

clause.p: The resulting consensus arrived at this definition for “metaverse”:

quote.p: metaverse: virtual world experienced through immersive technologies

clause.title: 6.1Purpose
clause.p: This deliverable aims to provide a concept system and a standard set of terminology related to the Metaverse, from basic concepts to those of the Metaverse ecosystem.
Questions to be addressed:

li.p: What is a Metaverse or is there only THE metaverse (like THE Internet)?
Does the Metaverse require human interaction?
Is there an agreed or proposed definition /definitions?
What shall it include? What does it not include?
Is a digital twin a “metaverse” if not why not? Or when is it not?
What is the minimum set to be classed as a metaverse?

clause.title: 6.2Methodology
clause.p: IEC/IEC JSEG 15/WS 1 used the following methodology in developing the vocabulary:

li.p: Survey existing terminology
Reference / import over new creation unless necessary
Decide on terms and domains to import
Fill out data: definition, designations, languages, examples, notes

clause.title: 6.3Sources investigated
clause.p: The sources that are investigated include:

li.p: Metaverse Standards Forum glossary ()
Open Metaverse Foundation glossary ()
IEEE P2874 Spatial Web
ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 24 “Metaverse Vocabulary”
IEC/ISO/JSEG 15/WS 2 “Market and applications report”

clause.title: 6.4Results
clause.p: The group has developed a set of terms and definitions for the Metaverse ecosystem. The terms are organized in the following categories:

li.p: Metaverse core concepts
Metaverse use cases
XR concepts
Extended metaverse concepts
Governance

clause.p: The terms and definitions are provided in a separate document.

clause.title: 7.1General
clause.p: The group recommends the following:

li.p: The definition of the “metaverse” should be adopted by IEC/ISO TCs and publications
The Metaverse terminology provided should be adopted by IEC/ISO TCs
